etymology.description: Depicts a tripod vessel with three legs used for rituals and cooking
etymology.interpretation: The character 鼎(鼎) (dǐng, 'tripod') represents an ancient bronze cooking or ritual vessel, symbolizing authority and importance due to its ceremonial use.

examples.chinese: 博物馆陈列着古代的鼎(博物館陳列著古代的鼎)，见证了中华文明(見證了中華文明)。
examples.pinyin: Bówùguǎn chénliè zhe gǔdài de dǐng, jiànzhèng le Zhōnghuá wénmíng.
examples.english: The museum displays ancient tripods, witnessing Chinese civilization.

examples.chinese: 传说中火神用鼎炼火(傳說中火神用鼎煉火)，铸就了神话传说(鑄就了神話傳說)。
examples.pinyin: Chuánshuō zhōng huǒshén yòng dǐng liàn huǒ, zhùjiù le shénhuà chuánshuō.
examples.english: Legend has it that the fire god used the tripod to refine fire, forging mythological tales.
